title: Horizontal asymptote of a composite sine function

content.description: The function f is given by <math> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mi>sin</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math>. Which of the following statements are true?
content.question: I. The graph of f has a horizontal asymptote at y=0 . II. The graph of f has a horizontal asymptote at y=1 . III. The graph of f has a vertical asymptote at x=0 .

topic.text: 1.15: Connecting Limits at Infinity and Horizontal Asymptotes

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
